X Head Coach Steve Thompson Alpine FIS Head Coach Will Courtney Communications and Development Coordinator Will Falltrick Executive Director Scott McGrew Born in the original Sun Valley hospital and raised on the slopes of Rotarun and Baldy, Scott McGrew‚Äôs connection to the Wood River Valley runs deep. A former SVSEF athlete himself, Scott has spent more than two decades serving the organization in nearly every role‚Äîfrom coach and program director to bus driver and, today, executive director. Scott is also a Level 3 Alpine Coach, Level 4 Chief of Race, Wilderness EMT, black belt in Taekwondo, and a once-fluent (now admittedly rusty) Spanish speaker. Scott‚Äôs education spans biochemistry at the University of Washington, dual degrees in Biology and Cultural Anthropology from the University of New Mexico, and an MBA from Boise State. A year studying at the University of Guadalajara and travels throughout Latin America shaped his lifelong curiosity for cultures, systems, and people. That perspective continues to influence how he leads‚Äîwith humility, purpose, and a deep respect for the real and sometimes messy human experience. In addition to leading SVSEF, Scott oversees operations at Rotarun Ski Area, expanding access to snow sports for local families and first-generation skiers. He and his wife are raising three kids who share their love of wild places and off-the-map adventures. For Scott, leadership is about more than direction‚Äîit‚Äôs about reimagining how we show up for each other, build trust, and grow together. While I never ski raced as a kid, I loved spending time around the races and this led to my first internship at Vail where I had the opportunity to work on the World Cup and other championship events. I moved to Boise, Idaho in 2008 to help lead the 2009 Special Olympics World Winter Games, and ultimately found my way to the Wood River Valley when I met my husband. Jesse and I were married at the base of Rotarun in December 2019, and I am honored to work with one of the most treasured non-profits in the valley. I love bringing my passion for storytelling to the organization and the community, and being part of a team driven by working hard, playing hard, and doing good for others. BEFORE I CAME TO SVSEF , I worked at Sun Valley Community School in Development for two years.
